mcq.statement: Why is Nankana Sahib considered sacred for Sikhs?

options.a: It is the birthplace of the First Guru of Sikhs
options.b: It is the site of a major battle

mcq.one_liner: Nankana Sahib is considered sacred for Sikhs because it is the birthplace of their First Guru, **Guru Nanak Dev Ji**.
